sen.j: 羽子板（はごいた）は、長方形で柄のある板。
sen.e: Hagoita (battledore) are long oblong pieces of wood with a handle.
Hagoita (battledore) are long oblong pieces of wood with a handle.
Hagoita (battledore) are long oblong pieces of wood with a handle.

sen.j: 羽根突きに用いる競技用の羽子板と、飾り羽子板に分別できる。
sen.e: Battledore racquets can be divided into those used for playing battledore and shuttlecock (a form of traditional Japanese badminton) and those used for decoration.
Battledore racquets can be divided into those used for playing battledore and shuttlecock (a form of traditional Japanese badminton) and those used for decoration.
Battledore racquets can be divided into those used for playing battledore and shuttlecock (a form of traditional Japanese badminton) and those used for decoration.

sen.j: 当初は羽根突きの道具として用いられたが、徐々に厄払いとしても使われるようになる。
sen.e: At first, Hagoita racquets were used just to play the game of battledore and shuttlecock however, slowly over time, the racquets came also to be used in exorcism rituals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At first, Hagoita racquets were used just to play the game of battledore and shuttlecock however, slowly over time, the racquets came also to be used in exorcism rituals.
At first, Hagoita racquets were used just to play the game of battledore and shuttlecock; however, slowly over time, the racquets came also to be used in exorcism rituals.
sen.cmt: howeverの前にセミコロン追加

sen.j: 魔除けとして正月に女性にあげる習慣もこのころ出来たとされる。
sen.e: Around this time the custom emerged where Hagoita racquets were given to women at new year time as talisman to ward off evil.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Around this time the custom emerged where Hagoita racquets were given to women at new year time as talisman to ward off evil.
Around this time the custom emerged where Hagoita racquets were given to women at new year time as talisman to ward off evil.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入ると、歌舞伎役者などをかたどった押絵羽子板が流行した。
sen.e: By the time the Edo period arrived, Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth appliqué-like portraits of traditional Japanese Kabuki theatre actors etc were a fad.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: By the time the Edo period arrived, Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth appliqué-like portraits of traditional Japanese Kabuki theatre actors etc were a fad.
By the time the Edo period arrived, Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth applique-like portraits of traditional Japanese Kabuki theatre actors etc were a fad.

sen.j: 現代では東京の伝統工芸品に指定されている。
sen.e: Nowadays, Hagoita racquets have been designated as traditional products of Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Nowadays, Hagoita racquets have been designated as traditional products of Tokyo.
Nowadays, Hagoita racquets have been designated as traditional products of Tokyo.

sen.j: 現代有名人をかたどった作品も出てきている。
sen.e: Hagoita racquets bearing images of current famous figures and celebrities are also produced.
Hagoita racquets bearing images of current famous figures and celebrities are also produced.
Hagoita racquets bearing images of current famous figures and celebrities are also produced.

sen.j: 江戸時代から現代に至るまで浅草寺では12月17日から12月19日まで「羽子板市」が開催されている。
sen.e: Since the Edo period through to modern times, a `Hagoita Racquet Festival` is held at the Asakusa temple between 17 – 19 December.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since the Edo period through to modern times, a `Hagoita Racquet Festival` is held at the Asakusa temple between 17 – 19 December.
Since the Edo period through to modern times, a 'Hagoita Racquet Festival' is held at the Senso-ji Temple between 17 – 19 December.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション表記修正、Asakusa temple→Senso-ji Templeに修正

sen.j: 毎年大勢の客が訪れることで有名である。
sen.e: The festival is famous for the throngs of visitors who flock to the festival each year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The festival is famous for the throngs of visitors who flock to the festival each year.
The festival is famous for the throngs of visitors who flock to the festival each year.

sen.j: 押絵羽子板の産地としては埼玉県春日部市とさいたま市岩槻区（旧岩槻市）が有名。
sen.e: Kasukabe city in Saitama prefecture and Iwatsuki ward (formerly Iwatsuki city) in Saitama city are famed production centers of Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth appliqué-like portraits.
Kasukabe city in Saitama prefecture and Iwatsuki ward (formerly Iwatsuki city) in Saitama city are famed production centers of Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth appliqué-like portraits.
Kasukabe City in Saitama Prefecture and Iwatsuki Ward (formerly Iwatsuki City) in Saitama City are famed production centers of Hagoita racquets festooned with cloth applique-like portraits.
sen.cmt: city, prefecture, wardの頭文字を大文字に修正、appliqué→appliqueとしました。

sen.j: また、羽子板市では株式会社久月が、その年に話題となった人物を素材にした変わり羽子板を作成、出展している。
sen.e: Also, at the Hagoita Racquet Festival, Kyugetsu Co. Ltd. produces and displays unusual Hagoita racquets that are adorned with images based on talked-about individuals of that given year.
Also, at the Hagoita Racquet Festival, Kyugetsu Co. Ltd. produces and displays unusual Hagoita racquets that are adorned with images based on talked-about individuals of that given year.
Also, at the Hagoita Racquet Festival, Kyugetsu Co. Ltd. produces and displays unusual Hagoita racquets that are adorned with images based on talked-about individuals of that given year.
